intro: Cracca glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth cracca, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and other related species. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate in shape, with a smooth texture and a slightly hairy underside. Cracca glabrescens is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and riverbanks.
